content.text:
# Warhol (crater)

| diameter    = 91 km
| eponym      = Andy Warhol
}}
Warhol is a crater on Mercury. Its name was adopted by the IAU in 2012, after the American artist Andy Warhol.
Hollows are abundant within Warhol.
MESSENGERmercurylimb.PNG|View of Mercury's limb at a high sun angle, with Warhol as the bright crater near center
Warhol crater EN1035068908M.jpg|Closeup of Warhol at high sun angle showing the abundant hollows on the crater floor (MESSENGER NAC)
Warhol crater EN1022253846M.jpg|Another closeup of Warhol (MESSENGER NAC)
